pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:0.5.eng: 22. The training rule on fewer than five mends

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country in the Banyan Tree Monastery at Kapilavatthu.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarena kumbhakārena bhikkhū pavāritā honti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.2.eng: At that time a potter had invited the monks, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.3.eng: “If any of you needs an almsbowl, I’ll provide it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū na mattaṃ jānitvā bahū patte viññāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.4.eng: But the monks had no sense of moderation, and they asked for many bowls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.5.pli: Yesaṃ khuddakā pattā te mahante patte viññāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.5.eng: Those who had small bowls asked for large ones,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.6.pli: Yesaṃ mahantā pattā te khuddake patte viññāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.6.eng: and those who had large bowls asked for small ones.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.7.pli: Atha kho so kumbhakāro bhikkhūnaṃ bahū patte karonto na sakkoti aññaṃ vikkāyikaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ kātuṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.7.eng: The potter was so busy making bowls for the monks that he was unable to make goods for sale.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.8.eng: He could not make a living for himself, and his wives and children suffered.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.10.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā na mattaṃ jānitvā bahū patte viññāpessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.10.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics have no sense of moderation and ask for many bowls?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.11.pli: Ayaṃ imesaṃ bahū patte karonto na sakkoti aññaṃ vikkāyikaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ kātuṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.11.eng: This potter is so busy making bowls for them that he is unable to make goods for sale.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.12.eng: He is unable to make a living for himself, and his wives and children are suffering.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.13.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.13.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.14.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.14.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.15.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū na mattaṃ jānitvā bahū patte viññāpessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.15.eng: “How can those monks have no sense of moderation and ask for many bowls?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.16.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū te anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.16.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.17.pli: saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na mattaṃ jānitvā bahū patte viññāpentīti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.17.eng: “Is it true, monks, that there are monks who do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.20.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā na mattaṃ jānitvā bahū patte viññāpessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.20.eng: “How can those foolish men do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.22.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.22.eng: After rebuking them, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.23.pli: “na, bhikkhave, patto viññāpetabbo. Yo viññāpeyya, āpatti dukkaṭassā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.23.eng: “Monks, a monk should not ask for an almsbowl. If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno patto bhinno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.1.eng: Soon afterwards the bowl of a certain monk broke.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.2.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu—“bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṃ pattaṃ viññāpetun”ti kukkuccāyanto na viññāpeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.2.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited asking for a bowl and being afraid of wrongdoing, he did not ask for a new one.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.3.eng: As a consequence, he collected almsfood with his hands.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā hatthesu piṇḍāya carissanti, seyyathāpi titthiyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.5.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics collect almsfood with their hands, just like the monastics of other religions?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.6.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.7.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.8.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.8.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.9.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, naṭṭhapattassa vā bhinnapattassa vā pattaṃ viññāpetun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.9.eng: “Monks, I allow you to ask for a new almsbowl if your bowl has been lost or is broken.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—“bhagavatā anuññātaṃ naṭṭhapattassa vā bhinnapattassa vā pattaṃ viññāpetun”ti appamattakenapi bhinnena appamattakenapi khaṇḍena vilikhitamattenapi bahū patte viññāpenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.1.eng: When they heard about the Buddha’s allowance, the monks from the group of six asked for many bowls even when their existing bowls only had a minor chip or scratch.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.2.pli: Atha kho so kumbhakāro bhikkhūnaṃ tatheva bahū patte karonto na sakkoti aññaṃ vikkāyikaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ kātuṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.2.eng: Once again that potter was so busy making bowls for the monks that he was unable to make goods for sale.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.3.eng: He could not make a living for himself, and his wives and children suffered.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.3.comm: “Children” renders putta/ā. In Pali the male gender takes precedent if a group contains people of both sexes. For instance, the plural puttā, “sons”, may mean “children” or “offsping”, depending on the context. In the same way, the plural bhātāro, “brothers”, can mean “siblings”. This way of understanding male-gender nouns is confirmed in the introduction to the Pali lexical work the Abhidhānappadīpikāṭīkā: Ettha hi mātā ca pitā ca pitaro, putto ca dhītā ca puttā, sassu ca sasuro ca sasurā, bhātā ca bhaginī ca bhātaroti bhinnaliṅgānampi ekaseso dassitoti, “‘Mother and father are fathers; son and daughter are sons; mother-in-law and father-in-law are fathers-in-law; brother and sister are brothers;’ in this case the split gender is shown with only one gender remaining.” The Abhidhānappadīpikāṭīkā is available online at tipitaka.org.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.4.eng: And people complained and criticized them as before.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā na mattaṃ jānitvā bahū patte viññāpessanti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.6.pli: Ayaṃ imesaṃ bahū patte karonto na sakkoti aññaṃ vikkāyikaṃ bhaṇḍaṃ kātuṃ, attanāpi na yāpeti, puttadārāpissa kilamantī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.7.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.7.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.8.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.8.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū appamattakenapi bhinnena appamattakenapi khaṇḍena vilikhitamattenapi bahū patte viññāpessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.9.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six ask for many bowls even when their existing bowls only has a minor chip or scratch?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.10.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.10.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.11.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, appamattakenapi bhinnena appamattakenapi khaṇḍena vilikhitamattenapi bahū patte viññāpethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.11.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.14.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, appamattakenapi bhinnena appamattakenapi khaṇḍena vilikhitamattenapi bahū patte viññāpessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.14.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.16.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.16.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.17.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu ūnapañcabandhanena pattena aññaṃ navaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.17.1.eng: ‘If a monk exchanges an almsbowl with fewer than five mends for a new almsbowl, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.18.pli: Tena bhikkhunā so patto bhikkhuparisāya nissajjitabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.18.eng: That monk should relinquish that almsbowl to a gathering of monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.19.pli: Yo ca tassā bhikkhuparisāya pattapariyanto so tassa bhikkhuno padātabbo— ‘ayaṃ te, bhikkhu, patto yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.19.eng: He should then be given the last almsbowl belonging to that gathering: “Monk, this bowl is yours. Keep it until it breaks.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.5.eng: An almsbowl with fewer than five mends:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.6.pli: abandhano vā ekabandhano vā dvibandhano vā tibandhano vā catubandhano vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.6.eng: it has no mends, one mend, two mends, three mends, or four mends.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.7.eng: An almsbowl with a mend that does not count:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.8.eng: one that does not have a fracture of 3.5 cm.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.8.comm: That is, a fracture of two fingerbreadths, dvaṅgulā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.9.eng: An almsbowl with a mend that counts:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.10.eng: one that does have a fracture of 3.5 cm.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.12.eng: asked for is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.14.eng: if he asks, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.15.eng: When he gets the bowl, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.16.eng: It should be relinquished in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.17.eng: All determined bowls should be brought together.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.18.eng: One should not determine an inferior bowl, thinking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.20.pli: Sace lāmakaṃ pattaṃ adhiṭṭheti— “mahagghaṃ pattaṃ gahessāmī”ti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.20.eng: If one determines an inferior bowl, thinking, “I’ll get a valuable one,” one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.21.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.22.pli: Tena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.22.eng: After approaching the Sangha, that monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.23.pli: “ayaṃ me, bhante, patto ūnapañcabandhanena pattena cetāpito nissaggiyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.23.eng: ‘Venerables, this almsbowl, which I got in exchange for a bowl that had fewer than five mends, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.24.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.25.eng: After relinquishing it, he should confess the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.26.eng: The confession should be received by a competent and capable monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.27.eng: A monk who has five qualities should be appointed as the distributor of almsbowls:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.28.pli: yo na chandāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na dosāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na mohāgatiṃ gaccheyya, na bhayāgatiṃ gaccheyya, gāhitāgāhitañca jāneyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.28.eng: one who is not biased by favoritism, ill will, confusion, or fear, and who knows what has and has not been distributed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.29.eng: “And, monks, this is how he should be appointed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.30.eng: First the monk should be asked,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.31.pli: Yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.31.eng: and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.32.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.33.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho itthannāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ pattaggāhāpakaṃ sammanneyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.33.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint monk so-and-so as the distributor of almsbowls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.35.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.36.eng: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as the distributor of almsbowls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.37.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno pattaggāhāpakassa sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.37.eng: Any monk who agrees to appointing monk so-and-so as the distributor of almsbowls should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.38.eng: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.39.eng: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so as the distributor of almsbowls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.40.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.42.eng: The appointed monk should give away that relinquished bowl.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.43.eng: He should tell the most senior monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.45.pli: Sace thero gaṇhāti, therassa patto dutiyassa gāhetabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.45.eng: If the most senior monk takes it, his old bowl should be offered to the next monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.46.pli: Na ca tassa anuddayatāya na gahetabbo. Yo na gaṇheyya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.46.eng: He should not not take that bowl out of sympathy. If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.47.eng: It is not to be offered to anyone who does not have bowl.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.48.eng: In this manner it should be offered all the way to the most junior monk in the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.49.pli: Yo ca tassā bhikkhuparisāya pattapariyanto, so tassa bhikkhuno padātabbo— “ayaṃ te, bhikkhu, patto yāva bhedanāya dhāretabbo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.49.eng: He should then be given the last almsbowl belonging to that gathering: “Monk, this bowl is yours. Keep it until it breaks”:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.50.pli: Tena bhikkhunā so patto na adese nikkhipitabbo, na abhogena bhuñjitabbo, na vissajjetabbo— “kathāyaṃ patto nasseyya vā vinasseyya vā bhijjeyya vā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.50.eng: That monk is not to store that bowl in an unsuitable place, use it in an unsuitable way, or give it away, thinking, “How may this bowl be lost, destroyed, or broken?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.51.pli: Sace adese vā nikkhipati abhogena vā bhuñjati vissajjeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.1.51.eng: If he stores it in an unsuitable place, uses it in an unsuitable way, or gives it away, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.1.pli: Abandhanena pattena abandhanaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.1.eng: If he exchanges a bowl without mends for a bowl without mends, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.2.pli: Abandhanena pattena ekabandhanaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.2.eng: If he exchanges a bowl without mends for a bowl with one mend, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.3.pli: Abandhanena pattena dvibandhanaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.3.eng: If he exchanges a bowl without mends for a bowl with two mends, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.4.pli: Abandhanena pattena tibandhanaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.4.eng: If he exchanges a bowl without mends for a bowl with three mends, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.5.pli: Abandhanena pattena catubandhanaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.5.eng: If he exchanges a bowl without mends for a bowl with four mends, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.6.pli: Ekabandhanena pattena abandhanaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.6.eng: If he exchanges a bowl with one mend for a bowl without mends, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.7.pli: Ekabandhanena pattena ekabandhanaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.7.eng: If he exchanges a bowl with one mend for a bowl with one mend, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.8.pli: Ekabandhanena pattena dvibandhanaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.8.eng: If he exchanges a bowl with one mend for a bowl with two mends, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.9.pli: Ekabandhanena pattena tibandhanaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.9.eng: If he exchanges a bowl with one mend for a bowl with three mends, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:2.2.10.pli: Ekabandhanena pattena catubandhanaṃ pattaṃ cetāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
